description: The 'draw_data_table' function generates a visual representation of a data table. It is designed to aid in the comprehension of tabular data by presenting it in a clear, organized, and visually appealing manner. The function is particularly useful in teaching data analysis and interpretation skills.

stimulus_type_specification.title: Available Images: Data Tables
stimulus_type_specification.description: The 'draw_data_table' function can generate images of data tables. It accepts a DataTable object as input, which contains headers, data, title, and metadata. The function has a few key constraints, such as a maximum cell width and a specific font size. The educational purpose of this function is to provide a visual aid for understanding and interpreting tabular data, which is a critical skill in many fields, including mathematics, science, and social studies.

details: The function accepts a DataTable object as input.
The DataTable object contains headers, data, title, and metadata.
The 'headers' field controls the column headers of the table.
The 'data' field controls the content of the table.
The 'title' field controls the title of the table. This field is optional.
The 'metadata' field contains additional information about the table. This field is optional.
The maximum width of a cell is 180 pixels.
The font size is set to 14 for the table content and 16 for the title.
The function uses the Arial font by default, but will use the system default font if Arial is not available.
The function generates an image of a data table.
The table includes a title (if provided), column headers, and data cells.
The appearance of the table (e.g., cell width, font size) is affected by the constraints of the function.

educational_standards.description: Interpret data with up to three categories.
Within 100, add a two-digit number and a multiple of 10.
Given a rule, create numbers in a multiplication pattern.
Explain patterns in an arithmetic pattern.

educational_standards.display_name: Identify Rules in Addition and Subtraction Patterns
educational_standards.description: Identify the rule for an addition or subtraction pattern.
Find missing terms in a pattern.
Given a rule, create numbers in a division pattern.
Identify the rule for a multiplication pattern.
Identify the rule for a division pattern.
Understand and convert between basic time units (seconds, minutes, hours) to solve time-related problems.

educational_standards.display_name: Measuring Length with Inches, Feet, Yards, and Miles
educational_standards.description: Convert and solve problems involving linear measurement using inches, feet, yards and miles.
Use the four operations to solve word problems involving money, including problems involving decimals.
Use the four operations to solve word problems involving liquid volumes, including problems involving decimals.
Use the four operations to solve word problems involving masses of objects, including problems involving decimals.
Solve real-world problems involving multiplying fractions by whole numbers.
Determine whether a given whole number in the range 1-100 is prime or composite.
Find all factors for a whole number in the range 1-100.

educational_standards.display_name: Whole Numbers Standard and Expanded Form
educational_standards.description: Convert between standard, word and expanded form for multi-digit numbers.
Read and write decimals to thousandths using expanded form with decimals.
Generate two numerical patterns based on the given rules and starting number.
Identify apparent relationships between corresponding terms in the two patterns.
Identify the relationship between corresponding terms of the two patterns.
Identify independent and dependent variables in situations.
Write an equation from a table.

Use positive and negative numbers in tandem to model real-world quantities that have opposite values or directions—such as temperatures above and below zero—interpreting zero as the neutral reference point in each context.
Interpret absolute value as magnitude for a positive or negative quantity in a real-world situation. Understand that |-a| = a.
Understand the concept of a unit rate a/b associated with a ratio a:b with b ≠ 0, and use rate language in the context of a ratio relationship in a real world situation.
Write equivalent ratios.
Interpret and analyze data presented in tables, charts, and graphs to solve problems involving measures of center, frequency, and percentages.

educational_standards.display_name: Finding Quantitative Measures from Charts and Graphs
educational_standards.description: Interpret charts and graphs to find mean, median, mode, and range.
Write an equation, y = mx, for a line through the origin.
Solve systems of two linear equations by graphing.
Identify whether or not a mathematical relation is a function.
Identify whether or not a function is linear.
Write an equation for a linear function from a table.
Interpret data on a two-way table.
